_metadata.description: Dinner main recipes extracted from Galveston Diet book
_metadata.notes: Converted to metric, AU ingredient names. For personal use.

recipes.name: Sesame Ginger Pork with Green Beans
recipes.description: Asian-inspired pork strips with garlic, ginger, and green beans, finished with toasted sesame.
recipes.batch_notes: Reheats well. Green beans may soften.
instructions: Place the sesame seeds in a small frypan over medium heat and toast until fragrant and lightly browned.
Lightly coat a medium frypan with cooking spray, add the pork strips and cook for 6-8 minutes until lightly browned.
Season the pork with salt and pepper, then transfer to a plate.
Add the coconut oil to the frypan. When melted, add the garlic, ginger, and green beans. Saute for 6-8 minutes until beans are tender.
Add the pork strips back to the frypan and drizzle in the tamari. Toss to combine.
Transfer to plates, sprinkle with toasted sesame seeds, and drizzle with sesame oil.

recipes.name: Capsicum Stuffed with Turkey and Cauliflower Rice
recipes.description: Red capsicum halves stuffed with spiced turkey mince and cauliflower rice, topped with melted cheddar.
recipes.batch_notes: Stuffed capsicums reheat well. Can freeze unbaked.
instructions: Preheat the oven to 150C. Lightly coat a medium baking dish with cooking spray.
Add the coconut oil to a medium frypan over medium heat. Add the turkey and cook for 5-8 minutes until no longer pink.
Transfer the turkey to a large bowl and add the cauliflower rice and garlic.
Season with cumin, paprika, pepper, and coriander. Mix well.
Arrange the capsicum halves on a board. Stuff the turkey mixture into the capsicum halves, patting firmly.
Top the stuffed capsicums with the cheese.
Place in the baking dish and bake for 10 minutes until cheese is lightly browned.

recipes.name: Prawns and Asparagus
recipes.description: Sauteed prawns with asparagus in lemon butter sauce, finished with parmesan and flaxseed.
recipes.batch_notes: Best made fresh. Prawns don't reheat well.
instructions: In a large frypan over medium heat, melt the butter and add the olive oil.
When oil is shimmering, add the prawns and asparagus and lightly saute for 3-4 minutes.
Add the garlic, stir well, then season with salt, pepper, and paprika if using.
Add the lemon zest and juice. Cook until prawns are pink throughout and asparagus is tender.
In a small bowl, combine the parmesan and flaxseed.
Sprinkle the cheese-flaxseed mixture over the prawns and asparagus, stir to coat, and serve.

recipes.name: Pumpkin and Chicken Curry with Cauliflower Rice
recipes.description: Creamy coconut curry with chicken, pumpkin, and red capsicum, served over cauliflower rice.
recipes.batch_notes: Curry reheats well. Make fresh cauliflower rice.
instructions: In a medium frypan over medium heat, heat the coconut oil until melted and hot.
Add the chicken and cook for 3-4 minutes, stirring continuously, until almost cooked through.
Add the red capsicum, pumpkin puree, curry powder, and any other spices of your choice. Stir well to coat.
Add the coconut milk, increase heat to medium-high, and bring to a boil.
Reduce heat to a simmer and cook slowly for 10 minutes.
Adjust spices to taste.
Transfer the curry to bowls and garnish with Thai basil. Serve with cauliflower rice.

recipes.name: Tofu in Peanut Sauce
recipes.description: Crispy tofu cubes in spicy turmeric-ginger peanut sauce, served with steamed broccolini.
recipes.batch_notes: Tofu and sauce reheat well. Can serve over cauliflower rice.
instructions: Sandwich the tofu between paper towels and plates. Place a heavy item on top and press for at least 30 minutes. Cut into cubes.
Combine the peanut butter, tamari, and water in a bowl.
Add the turmeric, sesame oil, red pepper flakes, and ginger. Mix well.
Steam or boil the broccolini until tender, about 5 minutes. Keep warm.
Heat the coconut oil in a large frypan over medium heat.
Add the tofu and cook for 10-15 minutes, turning occasionally, until lightly browned.
Stir in the sauce and blend well.
Transfer to serving bowls and serve with the warm broccolini.

recipes.name: Lemon Chicken with Capers
recipes.description: Pan-fried chicken breast in lemon-caper sauce, served with sauteed green beans and toasted almonds.
recipes.batch_notes: Chicken and beans reheat well. Sauce may need refreshing.
instructions: Pat the chicken pieces dry and season with salt and pepper.
In a large frypan over medium-high heat, add 15g ghee. When shimmering, add the chicken and cook 8-10 minutes, flipping once, until cooked through. Transfer to a plate and keep warm.
Add lemon juice, 15g ghee, garlic, and capers to the frypan. Bring to a simmer.
Add the lemon slices, return chicken to the frypan, reduce heat, and simmer for 5 minutes.
In another frypan over medium heat, warm remaining 30g ghee. Add onion and beans, cook until onion is translucent and beans are fork-tender, about 3 minutes.
Toss the almonds into the beans and stir to combine.
Arrange the chicken on a serving platter with the onion and beans alongside.

recipes.name: Broccoli and Cheese Chicken Bake
recipes.description: Creamy chicken and broccoli casserole with sour cream, garlic, and melted cheddar.
recipes.batch_notes: Reheats very well. Can be made ahead and baked when needed.
instructions: Preheat the oven to 190C.
Place the chicken in a large casserole dish, add the broccoli, and toss with olive oil.
In a medium bowl, combine the sour cream, thickened cream, garlic, and basil. Season with salt and pepper.
Pour the sauce into the casserole and stir to coat the chicken and broccoli.
Sprinkle the top with the cheese.
Bake for 7-10 minutes until heated through and bubbly. Serve.

recipes.name: Spaghetti Squash with Turkey, Bacon, Spinach, and Goat Cheese
recipes.description: Roasted spaghetti squash topped with turkey mince, crispy bacon, wilted spinach, and creamy goat cheese.
recipes.batch_notes: Squash and filling can be made ahead. Reheat together.
instructions: Preheat the oven to 200C. Line a baking tray with aluminium foil.
Cut the stem ends off the squash. Stand upright and cut in half lengthwise. Scoop out seeds.
Season flesh with olive oil, salt, and pepper. Place cut-side down on the baking tray.
Bake for 40-60 minutes until a fork goes in easily.
While squash is cooking, cook bacon in a large frypan until crisp, about 10 minutes. Set aside on paper towels.
Add turkey to the frypan and brown for 5-8 minutes. Transfer to a bowl, drain most fat leaving about 15g.
With frypan over medium heat, pour in the wine and scrape up browned bits. Cook 1 minute to reduce by half.
Add spinach, stir until wilted, about 3 minutes. Crumble in goat cheese and stir to soften, about 3 minutes.
Crumble the bacon and stir into the turkey. Add the spinach-cheese mixture and stir to blend.
When squash is cool enough to handle, use a fork to comb out the flesh into strands. Place in serving bowls.
Top each serving with the turkey, bacon, and spinach mixture.

recipes.name: Meatloaf with Cauliflower Mash
recipes.description: Classic grass-fed beef meatloaf with almond flour binder, served with creamy cauliflower mash.
recipes.batch_notes: Meatloaf slices and reheats excellently. Make ahead for weeknight dinners.
instructions: Preheat the oven to 180C.
Heat the olive oil in a small frypan, add the onion, and saute until translucent, about 3 minutes.
In a large bowl, combine the beef mince, sauteed onion, almond flour, eggs, tomato sauce, parmesan, salt, pepper, and garlic powder.
Shape the mixture into a firm oval loaf.
Place the loaf in a shallow baking pan or loaf tin, and bake for 1 hour.
Carefully remove the loaf from the pan, discarding the surrounding fat, and transfer to a serving platter.
Let rest for about 10 minutes, then slice for serving.
Place slices on plates with portions of mashed cauliflower. Top cauliflower with butter if desired.

recipes.name: Grilled Steak with Creamed Spinach and Mushrooms
recipes.description: Grilled sirloin steaks topped with sauteed mushrooms, served with nutmeg-spiced creamed spinach.
recipes.batch_notes: Best made fresh. Steak can be cooked ahead and sliced cold.
instructions: Preheat a grill pan over medium-high heat.
Season the steaks with salt and pepper.
Place steaks in the grill pan and cook for 2-4 minutes on each side for medium-rare.
Transfer to a platter and cover to keep warm.
Add the olive oil to a medium frypan over medium-high heat. When shimmering, add the mushrooms, stirring for 3-4 minutes until lightly browned.
Transfer mushrooms to the platter with steaks and spread on top. Cover to keep warm.
Lower heat for the frypan to medium. Add the spinach and cream.
Cook, stirring, until spinach has wilted and cream has thickened slightly.
Season with salt and nutmeg.
Serve the steak and mushrooms with creamed spinach on the side.

recipes.name: Slow Cooker Mushroom Stroganoff with Creamy Garlic Cauliflower Rice
recipes.description: Vegetarian slow-cooked mushroom stroganoff with paprika and yoghurt, served over garlic cauliflower rice.
recipes.batch_notes: Stroganoff reheats excellently. Make cauliflower rice fresh.
instructions: Place mushrooms, 24g garlic, onion, 480ml broth, and paprika in a slow cooker. Cook on high for 4 hours.
Stir in the yoghurt. Season with salt and pepper. Cover and keep warm.
Process cauliflower florets in a food processor until they resemble rice grains.
Heat a large saucepan over medium heat. Add olive oil, then cauliflower rice, remaining 8g garlic, 3g salt, and 1g pepper.
Bring to a boil and cook for 3 minutes, stirring gently.
Pour in remaining 240ml broth, cover, reduce heat to medium-low, and simmer for 12 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Stir in the ghee and cream, simmer another 5 minutes until creamy.
Serve the stroganoff over the creamy cauliflower rice, garnished with parsley.

recipes.name: BLT Salmon Burgers
recipes.description: Salmon patties on a woven turkey bacon base with avocado-flaxseed spread, lettuce, and tomato.
recipes.batch_notes: Salmon patties can be made ahead. Bacon weaves can be prepped. Assemble fresh.
instructions: Preheat oven to 200C. Line a baking tray with foil and place a baking rack in it.
Create 4 bacon weaves: Arrange 3 bacon half-strips in a row. Weave 3 more strips through them. Flatten with a rolling pin and transfer to the rack. Repeat for 4 weaves.
Bake until crisp, about 25 minutes. Drain on paper towels and keep warm.
Mash the salmon in a bowl with mayonnaise until shapeable. Season with salt and pepper. Form into 4 patties.
Heat olive oil in a frypan over medium-high heat. Cook salmon patties for about 8 minutes, flipping once, until browned.
In a bowl, stir together avocado, flaxseed, lemon juice, and chives.
Place a bacon weave on each plate. Spread with avocado mixture.
Top with a salmon burger, lettuce leaf, and tomato slice.

recipes.name: Baked Salmon with Grilled Summer Squash
recipes.description: Honey-garlic baked salmon on lemon slices, served with butter-grilled zucchini and yellow squash.
recipes.batch_notes: Best made fresh. Salmon can be baked ahead and served cold.

ingredients.name: Lemon
ingredients.notes: 2 lemons - 1 zested and juiced, 1 thinly sliced

instructions: Preheat an outdoor grill to medium and lightly oil the grill.
Place yellow squash and zucchini slices on separate squares of aluminium foil. Pour 15g melted butter over the slices. Sprinkle with lemon zest, juice, salt, pepper, and cayenne.
Fold and wrap the squash in foil. Place on the grill and grill until tender, about 30 minutes.
Preheat the oven to 180C. Line a baking tray with foil and spray with cooking spray.
Arrange lemon slices in an even layer in the centre of the tray. Season both sides of salmon with salt and pepper. Place on top of lemons.
Whisk together remaining 85g butter, honey, garlic, thyme, and oregano. Pour over the salmon. Fold the foil up around it.
Bake until salmon flakes easily, 15-20 minutes. Turn oven to grill and grill for 2 minutes until top is lightly browned.
Remove squash packets from grill. Transfer salmon to a serving platter.
Garnish with parsley sprigs and serve grilled squash alongside.

recipes.name: Grilled Prawns with Grilled Tomato Bites
recipes.description: Italian herb-marinated grilled prawns served with parmesan-topped grilled tomatoes.
recipes.batch_notes: Best made fresh. Prawns don't reheat well.
instructions: Place 80g olive oil, lemon juice, 5g salt, pepper, Italian seasoning, and garlic in a large resealable bag. Seal and shake to combine.
Place prawns in a baking dish and pour marinade over. Refrigerate for 15 minutes to 2 hours. Meanwhile, soak 4 bamboo skewers in water.
Cut tomatoes in half. Cut a small sliver from the bottom so they stand upright. Brush with remaining 30g olive oil and sprinkle with parmesan.
Preheat grill to medium hot. Preheat grill element in oven.
Thread prawns onto skewers. Grill for 2-3 minutes on each side until pink and opaque. Transfer to a platter and cover.
Place tomatoes in a baking dish under the grill element. Grill for 3 minutes until cheese is lightly toasted. Watch carefully.
Arrange tomatoes around the prawn skewers on the platter.
Sprinkle prawns with parsley and serve with lemon wedges.

recipes.name: Blackened Tofu with Sesame Broccoli Slaw
recipes.description: Spice-rubbed crispy tofu cubes served over stir-fried broccoli slaw with sesame seeds.
instructions: Place the tofu cubes in a medium bowl. Add the herbs and seasoning and rub to coat the cubes.
Place 30g coconut oil in a large frypan over high heat. When melted, add the tofu and saute for 3-4 minutes on each side until blackened.
Transfer to a bowl, cover, and keep warm.
Wipe out the frypan and add remaining 30g coconut oil over medium-high heat.
When melted, add the broccoli slaw and stir-fry until desired tenderness, about 2 minutes.
Spread the sauteed slaw on individual plates.
Top with the blackened tofu and sprinkle with sesame seeds.

recipes.name: BBQ Tempeh, Greens, and Cauliflower Rice
recipes.description: Marinated BBQ tempeh triangles with sauteed kale and parmesan cauliflower rice.
recipes.batch_notes: Tempeh can be marinated overnight. Cauliflower rice best fresh.
instructions: Combine BBQ sauce, orange juice, tamari, and vinegar in a shallow pan. Slice tempeh into triangles. Marinate for at least 1 hour, preferably overnight.
Cut cauliflower into florets. Pulse in food processor to rice texture.
Heat ghee in a large frypan over medium heat. Add onion and cook until translucent, 4 minutes.
Add cauliflower rice, garlic powder, and nutmeg. Season with salt. Saute 5-7 minutes.
In another frypan, heat olive oil. Add garlic and saute until fragrant, 1 minute. Add kale and saute 2-3 minutes until wilted. Stir in lemon juice and salt.
Heat grill pan or cast-iron frypan with coconut oil. Drain tempeh, reserving marinade.
Grill tempeh 5 minutes per side, brushing with marinade occasionally.
Stir parsley and parmesan into cauliflower rice.
Spoon cauliflower rice into bowls, add tempeh, brush with remaining marinade. Sprinkle with peanuts if using. Serve kale alongside.

recipes.name: Veggie Cheese Enchiladas with Grain-Free Tortillas
recipes.description: Homemade grain-free tortillas filled with spiced vegetables, eggs, spinach, and cheese, baked in enchilada sauce.
recipes.batch_notes: Enchiladas can be assembled ahead and baked when needed. Tortillas freeze well.
instructions: Make tortilla dough: Combine flours, xanthan gum, baking powder, and salt in food processor. Pulse 5 seconds. Add lime juice, 1 egg, then water. When dough forms a ball, knead briefly, wrap in plastic, refrigerate 10 minutes.

Make sauce: Combine tomato sauce, broth, vinegar, 8g chilli powder, paprika, 3g cumin, onion powder, and 2g garlic powder in saucepan. Heat to near boil, reduce and simmer 15-30 minutes until thickened.
Shape tortillas: Divide dough into 8 balls. Roll each between parchment to 5-6 inches diameter. Cook in hot cast-iron frypan about 20 seconds per side.

Make filling: Heat avocado oil in saucepan. Saute onion and capsicum until softened, 3 minutes. Add zucchini, then remaining 3 eggs, stir to scramble. Add spinach, remaining chilli powder, garlic salt, onion powder, and cumin. Simmer until heated through.
Assemble: Place a tortilla flat, spoon on 1/2 cup filling and 1 1/2 tbsp cheese. Roll up and place in 33x23cm baking dish. Repeat with remaining tortillas.
Preheat oven to 180C. Pour sauce over enchiladas and sprinkle remaining cheese on top.
Bake 30 minutes until heated through and cheese is browned.

recipes.name: Spicy Edamame Bowl with Creamy Chilli Sauce
recipes.description: Stir-fried edamame with coleslaw, ginger, and sriracha, topped with creamy chilli mayo sauce.

ingredients.name: Spring onions
ingredients.notes: 6, green and white parts sliced separately

instructions: Heat sesame oil in a large frypan over medium heat. Add white parts of spring onions, red onion, and garlic. Saute until onion softens, about 3 minutes.
Add frozen edamame, ginger, and 15g hot sauce. Cook until edamame is heated through, about 3 minutes.
Add coleslaw mix, tamari, vinegar, white pepper, and salt. Stir well. Cook, stirring regularly, until cabbage is tender, about 5 minutes.
Make chilli sauce: Whisk together mayonnaise and remaining 15g hot sauce. Season with salt.
Spoon edamame mixture into serving bowls.
Drizzle chilli sauce over the top. Garnish with spring onion greens and black sesame seeds.
